description: Introductory quantum mechanics, atomic and molecular structure, chemical bonding, and microscopic understanding of physical and chemical properties of molecules.
name: PHYSICAL CHEMISTRY I

values.comments:
CHEM 221-001, Professor Rappe
This is an introductory course to quantum mechanics, atomic and molecular
structure, chemical bonding, and microscopic understanding of physical and chemical
properties of molecules.
One student said, “The course is difficult and somewhat overwhelming for me.
You really have to be strong with complex integrals to be very successful. But, otherwise
the subject matter is interesting.
Students found Dr. Rappe's teaching style to be very effective. He clearly knew
his stuff, but he sometimes went through things very fast. Another student said that
Rappe was the best instructor this course could possibly have. The information was very
obscure and hard to grasp, and he refused to move on until he was convinced that most of
the class had some understanding of what is going on. Students did not like that professor
Rappe often had to hold classes via Skype due to his schedule.
The prerequisites for this course include CHEM 102, MATH 114, and PHYS 150.
Students warn that a strong mathematical background is required. Students who are not
engineers had much more difficulty mastering the material.
*Based on the 10 student reviews
